page.title: 12PAPER HALL, BRADFORD
page.content: Near our school there is{Paper Hall. It is a very old building, so old it is falling down. It was built in the middle of the 17th C. The house was owned by rich people. The Paper Hall is {the oldest house still standing {near the centre of the city.} For a long time we haven't been able to see it properly. We can only see the roof of the Hall. The rest is covered up by boards because people are trying to save it. Work began in Sept 1980. It will take a lot of time and money. Paper Hall is important in Bradford's history because{James Garnett,} owner of Barkerend Mills, used to live there. He had {the first spinning {machine put in his mill in 1792. }It was important for Bradford because of the Wool Industry. A {Paper Hall {Preservation Society} is trying to raise money for the Hall.
